prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What does the universe have in store for me within the next three months?

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a detailed list of the horary chart data points drawn from your chart using traditional horary principles to serve as the basis for our upcoming interpretation:

1. Planetary Placements and Degrees:
 • Sun at 24°59′ Aquarius (located in the chart’s 1st house per provided data)
 • Moon at 5°11′ Virgo
 • Mercury at 28°05′ Aquarius
 • Venus at 5°55′ Aries
 • Mars at 17°44′ Cancer (noted as retrograde)
 • Jupiter at 11°25′ Gemini
 • Saturn at 18°49′ Pisces
 • Uranus at 23°20′ Taurus
 • Neptune at 28°21′ Pisces
 • Pluto at 2°26′ Aquarius
 • North Node at 29°11′ Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron at 19°55′ Aries

2. Angular Points and House Cusps:
 • Ascendant at 23°45′ Capricorn (listing multiple aspects)
 • Midheaven (MC) at 19°02′ Scorpio
 • IC at 19°02′ Taurus
 • House placements as provided:
  – 1st House (Capricorn): contains Sun, Mercury, Pluto
  – 2nd House (Pisces): contains Venus, Saturn, Neptune, North Node, Chiron
  – 3rd House (Aries)
  – 4th House (Taurus): contains Uranus
  – 5th House (Gemini): contains Jupiter
  – 6th House (Gemini): contains Mars
  – 7th House (Cancer): contains Moon
  – 8th House (Virgo)
  – 9th House (Libra)
  – 10th House (Scorpio)
  – 11th House (Sagittarius)
  – 12th House (Sagittarius)

3. Major Aspects (with orb values noted):
 • MC Opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 • Uranus Trine Ascendant (orb: 0°)
 • Saturn Sextile IC (orb: 1°)
 • Sun Square Uranus (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
 • Saturn Trine MC (orb: 1°)
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 1°)
 • Mars Sextile IC (orb: 2°)
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 2°)
 • Mars Trine MC (orb: 2°)
 • Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 3°)
 • Ascendant Sextile MC (orb: 4°)
 • Chiron Square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus Opposition MC (orb: 4°)
 • Uranus Conjunction IC (orb: 4°)
 • Sun Conjunction Mercury (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant Trine IC (orb: 4°)
 • Neptune Sextile Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn Sextile Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 5°)
 • Sun Sextile Chiron (orb: 5°)
 • Mercury Square Uranus (orb: 5°)
 • Sun Square IC (orb: 5°)
 • Sun Square MC (orb: 5°)
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Venus Sextile Jupiter (orb: 6°)
 • Moon Square Jupiter (orb: 6°)
 • Mars Opposition Ascendant (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter Square Saturn (orb: 7°)
 • Moon Opposition Mercury (orb: 7°)
 • Venus Conjunction Neptune (orb: 7°)

4. Chart Patterns:
 • Grand Trine: Mars (17° Cancer), MC (19° Scorpio), Saturn (18° Pisces)
 • Castle Formation: Involving Mars (17° Cancer), MC (19° Scorpio), Saturn (18° Pisces), IC (19° Taurus), Ascendant (23° Capricorn) and Uranus (23° Taurus)
 • T-Square Pattern #1: Involving MC (19° Scorpio), Sun (24° Aquarius), IC (19° Taurus) with Uranus (23° Taurus)
 • T-Square Pattern #2: Involving Mars (17° Cancer), Chiron (19° Aries), Ascendant (23° Capricorn)
 • Rectangle Pattern: Involving Mars (17° Cancer), IC (19° Taurus), MC (19° Scorpio), Ascendant (23° Capricorn), Uranus (23° Taurus)
 • Yod: Involving Moon (5° Virgo), Pluto (2° Aquarius), Venus (5° Aries)
 • Cradles (multiple):
  – Cradle #1: Mars (17° Cancer), Ascendant (23° Capricorn), Neptune (28° Pisces), Uranus (23° Taurus)
  – Cradle #2: Mars (17° Cancer), Ascendant (23° Capricorn), Saturn (18° Pisces), IC (19° Taurus)
  – Cradle #3: Uranus (23° Taurus), MC (19° Scorpio), Ascendant (23° Capricorn), Neptune (28° Pisces)
  – Cradle #4: Uranus (23° Taurus), MC (19° Scorpio), Ascendant (23° Capricorn), Saturn (18° Pisces), IC (19° Taurus)

5. Special Features and Additional Notes:
 • The Moon is a waning gibbous.
 • The inner planets distribute evenly among the three modes (Cardinal, Mutable, Fixed).
 • A concentration of planets in the lower left quadrant, with an empty top left quadrant.
 • Uranus and the IC are on the Nadir.
 • The sextile aspect appears most frequently (12 times).
 • The Ascendant participates in 11 aspects.
 • Neptune in Pisces is placed in the sign of its rulership.

All these points form the structural base for the horary interpretation within the next three months. Further analysis will involve evaluating the interplay among these factors according to horary principles.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Based on the chart data provided, here is an interpretation of what the universe appears to be preparing for you over the next three months:

1. The Sun in Aquarius alongside Mercury and Pluto in your 1st house suggests a strong focus on personal identity and self-expression. However, the Sun’s square to Uranus (with Uranus also influencing your IC and Ascendant) indicates unexpected disruptions in your personal realm. These disruptions may challenge your usual mode of operation but can also serve as a catalyst for refreshing change.

2. The T-square formed by the Sun in Aquarius, Uranus in Taurus (located near the IC), and the Midheaven in Scorpio underlines a tension between your internal foundations (home, inner emotional life) and your public or professional identity. This challenge may prompt realignment of priorities, inviting you to rebuild aspects of your life in ways that prioritize authenticity over convention.

3. The grand trine connecting Mars in Cancer, Saturn in Pisces, and the Midheaven (MC) in Scorpio provides a stabilizing influence amid these disruptions. Mars in Cancer, especially when considered with its sextile and trine aspects, points to an opportunity to assert yourself in a way that is both emotionally honest and strategically measured. Saturn’s presence in Pisces and its sextile connections suggest that disciplined adjustments in your personal values and material concerns can support long-lasting change.

4. The rectangle and multiple cradle formations that involve Mars, Ascendant, Neptune, Uranus, and to some extent Saturn, indicate an ongoing dynamic of transformation and healing. Mars square Chiron warns that impulsive actions could bring up old wounds. However, if you work toward acknowledging and healing these hurt patterns, an opportunity for personal growth emerges during this cycle.

5. The Yod pattern, involving the Moon in Virgo, Pluto in Aquarius, and Venus in Aries, draws attention to transformative issues tied to relationships and personal desires. This configuration signals that subtle, karmic or destined adjustments in your approach to intimacy and partnership might be necessary. You may be called to examine underlying motives and expectations, inviting you to reconfigure connections to support deeper alignment with your true self.

6. With the Moon in Virgo placed in the 7th house and in hard aspect to Mercury and Jupiter, interpersonal interactions are likely to require extra care. There may be miscommunications or tensions within significant relationships. The challenge lies in balancing your analytical approach and attention to detail with a more intuitive, empathic way of engaging others.

7. Venus in Aries in the 2nd house, supported by aspects to Neptune and Saturn in Pisces, emphasizes a shift in how you value yourself and your resources. The configuration calls for innovative ways to manage financial or material matters while balancing dreams with practicality. This could be a period of reevaluating what you hold dear and adjusting your financial or value system accordingly.

8. The overall pattern suggests that while there are challenging tensions—most notably through Uranus and the T-square involving the Sun, Uranus, and the MC—there is also a stabilizing energy from the grand trine (Mars, Saturn, MC) that offers an anchor. This blend invites transformation that, though disruptive at times, is deeply aligned with growth and evolution. The energy present calls for a conscious rebalancing between inner stability and external change, ensuring that shifts are integrated into a renewed public identity.

These indications point to a period that will involve both unexpected shifts and earthy, stabilizing opportunities. Pay attention to moments when spontaneous change invites you to abandon old structures, as well as those times when disciplined action provides the framework for rebuilding a stronger, more authentic foundation.
